body_html:
Thanks @freedomtan. That perfectly matches my understanding.

I think you should ask NVIDIA to support it or "use the source" and "scratch your own itch".

As far as I know, NVIDIA do not recommend using TensorFlow on the TXs because it's slow and consumes too much memory. Google suggest to use TFLite now, but it seems to share the same build problems. Given the situation, I'd switch to an alternative framework e.g. MXNet or Caffe2, and recommend our community to do the same. If my response makes Google guys angry (and thus reluctant to fix this problem), it will just prove the point :)).

body:
Thanks @freedomtan. That perfectly matches my understanding.

> I think you should ask NVIDIA to support it or "use the source" and "scratch your own itch".

As far as I know, NVIDIA do not recommend using TensorFlow on the TXs because it's slow and consumes too much memory. Google suggest to use TFLite now, but it seems to share the same build problems. Given the situation, I'd switch to an alternative framework e.g. MXNet or Caffe2, and recommend our community to do the same. If my response makes Google guys angry (and thus reluctant to fix this problem), it will just prove the point :)).
